message.content: Merism is a figure of speech used in literature, where an object or concept is described by listing its parts or attributes. It involves using exaggerated language to emphasize or convey the magnitude or extent of something. Merisms can be used for emphasis, humor, or to create vivid imagery. Examples include "from head to toe," "top to bottom," "inside and out," "front and back," "left and right," etc.
